DOC.brief_summary: This study will be conducted in a Clinical Research Center (CRC) setting and recruiting type 1 diabetes that are currently using an insulin pump.
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study Assessing the Ability of an Insulin Pump-controlling Algorithm to Minimize Hypoglycemia
DOC.detailed_description: This study is a non-randomized, uncontrolled feasibility study that looks to enroll people with type 1 diabetes who are currently using an insulin pump. During the subject's participation, the study staff will closely monitor the study subject in a clinical research center environment for approximately 30 hours, while controller algorithm determined insulin doses are delivered by an insulin pump, and utilizing continuous glucose monitoring results.
DOC.criteria: Age 2165 years Type 1 diabetes mellitus for at least one year Currently using an insulin infusion pump for at least the past 6 months Pregnancy History of Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA) in the past six months History of severe hypoglycemia (Seizure, unconsciousness) in the past 6 months
